title: NASA's Curiosity Finds Surprise Clues to Mars' Watery Past
summary: Among other discoveries made by the rover, rippled rock textures suggest lakes existed in a region of ancient Mars that scientists expected to be drier.

title: Progress MS-22 resupply ship ready for launch to ISS
summary: Roscosmos is ready to launch its next Progress resupply craft to the International Space Station (ISS). Liftoff of the Progress MS-22 mission is scheduled for 06:15 UTC on Feb. 9 from Site 31/6 at the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan aboard a Soyuz-2.1a rocket. It will then spend two days performing maneuvers until it docks with the ISS.

title: Mysterious Russian satellites are now breaking apart in low-Earth orbit
summary: "This suggests to me that perhaps these events are the result of a design error."

title: NASA Awards Simulation and Software Technology Services Contract
summary: NASA has awarded the Simulation and Software Technology III contract to CACI Federal of Chantilly, Virginia, to provide simulation and software technology support and related services for the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston.

title: New York Students to Hear from NASA Astronaut Aboard Space Station
summary: Students from Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. School No. 9 in Rochester, New York, will have an opportunity this week to hear from a NASA astronaut aboard the International Space Station.

title: NASA's Aerospace Safety Advisory Panel Releases 2022 Annual Report
summary: The Aerospace Safety Advisory Panel (ASAP), an advisory committee that reports to NASA and Congress, issued its 2022 annual report Tuesday, Feb. 7, 2023, examining the agency’s safety performance, accomplishments, and challenges over the past year.

title: Here’s why Europe is abandoning plans to fly aboard China’s space station
summary: Increasingly, the European Space Agency is aligned with NASA and the West.

title: Perseverance completes sample return depot, Ingenuity continues flights
summary: As the two-year landing anniversary of NASA’s Perseverance rover and its small scouting helicopter Ingenuity draws near, the pair continue to explore Jezero Crater and unlock the many secrets of the red planet.

title: Stoke Space to build SpaceX Raptor engine’s first real competitor
summary: Seattle startup Stoke Space has revealed plans to develop an efficient rocket engine similar to the Raptors that power SpaceX’s Starship. Formed...

title: Using Hubble, researchers measure the mass of a single white dwarf for the first time
summary: Of the trillions of stars scattered throughout the universe, one of the most common are the white dwarfs, which are the dormant, burned out, and leftover cores of low/medium mass stars. For decades, scientists have only measured the masses of white dwarfs within binary star systems. While these measurements provide insight into the true masses of white dwarfs, the measurements typically feature high amounts of uncertainty.
